product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text:
Bought this moisturizer to add to my morning skincare routine skincare routine and it did not disappoint! It doesn't feel heavy going on, just super light and hydrating.
I'm loving this brand, my dry irritated eczema skin feeling so good from it. Currently using the Byoma Milky Toner, Eye Serum, and Retinol Oil. Definitely recommend!

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text:
I've finally found my holy grail moisturizer!! Byoma Moisturizing Rich Cream has transformed my sensitive skin, quenching its thirst for hydration and soothing its irritability. Rich & non-greasy texture, absorbs quickly, leaving my skin feeling so soft. Keeps my skin hydrated for up to 24 hours, reducing dryness and irritation. What I love about it the most is, it has ceramides, hyaluronic acid, and niacin-amide which work synergistically to lock in the moisture, strengthen the skin barrier, and reduce inflammation. It is fragrance-free, hypoallergenic, and gentle enough for even the most delicate complexions. 

@byoma Moisturizing Rich Cream has become an essential step in my daily skincare routine. It's the perfect complement to my gentle cleanser and serum, providing an intense dose of hydration and nourishment. Really recommend to everyone!!! üíï

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text: I lived in colorado for 4 years and would dread winter because i knew what would happen to my skin. No matter what i tried my face inevitably ended up dry, cracked, flaky, and sensitive around my chin. I tried so many different moisturizers, getting facials, slugging, exfoliants to get the dead skin off, and nothing helped. I'm not sure when i picked this up, but within a week my skin did a complete 180. I was trying another product at the time and stopped using this for a few days to determine which was helping and i very quickly found out it was this one. I've never looked back. The only con is the packaging. The pump can be annoying to get going, and also i wish it came in a bigger size!

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text:
I order from Ulta quite often and this time was a little different.  Usually my products come in a box but this time they came packaged in a bubble mailer, which isn't the issue or a problem at all, I just noticed that was the first thing different. 
Second thing I noticed it came from the Return Center, which maybe I never paid attention to before but that for some reason stuck out to me.
Third, all my products came in perfect condition except for this one.  The top came off super easy as if the circle sticker seal on the right side of the bottle where the cap meets was already cut as if this had been tried out, returned and then re sold to me apparently.  This is just what I formed in my own opinion after opening my package.  Maybe I'm wrong, but as an avid consumer this was a different situation in my opinion and why was my seal already broken?

I have the Jelly Cleanser, Hydrating Toner, Hydrating Serum, Rich Cream, Barrier+ Treatment and Hydrating Recovery Oil.

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text: Bakuchiol while safe for sensitive skin, it stimulates cell turnover as a gentler option to Retinol. So I have a hunch most people are using this daily if not 2x a day which I would def not recommend - that would explain all of the reviews highlighting breakouts. Start slow & steady, test patch & see how your skin reacts first. I enjoy this moisturizer & while it's hydrating at application, it does feel like it dries down pretty quickly after. I don't use it daily, but it's a good PM moisturizer option under an oil for improving skin texture and plumping. (gifted by Byoma in exchange for honest review)

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text: Truly have liked all the byoma products I've tried but this is definitely one of my favs! Thick enough for my dry skin but not too heavy. It's not greasy and absorbs well which I love. I also love that it's unscented. The packaging could be improved tho! Gifted by byoma

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text: I received this product complimentary from byoma. This was my first time trying a product from byoma, and I'm honestly shocked by how effective and beneficial this cream is at such an affordable price on top of being blown away by the education they provide about their formulas. This cream is fragrance free and has a thick, rich consistency that surprisingly melts into my skin quickly without stripping it or leaving it feeling heavy and weighed down. It immediately soothes my skin and deeply hydrates it while also softening it and providing restorative properties. It also protects and strengthens my barrier, leaving me with a healthy glowing appearance. I'm so surprised by how great this moisturizer is, and I definitely think it will be perfect for the cold months!

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text: Byoma Rich Cream Moisturizer is a standout product for anyone seeking intense hydration without a heavy feel. Its rich, creamy texture melts into the skin, delivering deep moisture that lasts throughout the day. Packed with beneficial ingredients like ceramides and hyaluronic acid, it effectively supports the skin's barrier and keeps dryness at bay. Ideal for both morning and night use, it absorbs quickly and leaves a soft, supple finish. Plus, its clean formulation and eco-friendly packaging make it a great choice for conscious consumers. Overall, it's a fantastic option for anyone looking to boost their skincare routine with a reliable moisturizer. It was gifted to me by Byoma

Gifted by Byoma.

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream
review_text: Gifted by byoma. BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Face Cream offers a rich, thick, yet non-tacky formula that deeply hydrates the skin. I appreciate the Tri-Ceramide Complex, which supports the skin barrier, and the inclusion of bakuchiol and shea extracts, which nourish and soothe. The fact that it's alcohol- and fragrance-free makes it gentle on sensitive skin, and it's reassuring to know it's dermatologist tested. It's an excellent choice for daily hydration, especially for those seeking a barrier-supportive cream.

product_name: BYOMA Moisturizing Rich Cream

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text: I've had oily skin my entire life and haven't needed much in the name of moisturizer. I'm used to getting away with a light liquid (Dr Jart's is my holy grail).. but as I'm approaching 40, winters do dry me out, I'm noticing a change, and wrinkles starting to creep in. I've sampled the whole gamut of moisturizers thanks to Sephora, trying to find one that doesn't break me out.. hyaluronic acid causes me acne and it's in everything these days. I recently tried this one and it's serum cousin as samples - the serum breaks me out, but not this. This one is it. So I took the plunge and have been using it regularly for a week now, and no breakouts, even with gym workouts/sweat in the mix. It's definitely improved my skin quality and I like the dispensing mechanism, as I find jars unhygienic. Also happy they have the refill option to reduce plastic waste as well.

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text: Drunk Elephant's Lala Retro‚Ñ¢ Whipped Moisturizer stands out with its rich yet airy whipped texture that melts effortlessly into the skin, delivering deep hydration without feeling heavy or greasy. Packed with six African oils and plant ceramides, it's a powerhouse for strengthening the skin barrier, locking in moisture, and protecting against environmental stressors. I love how it instantly soothes dryness and irritation, making it perfect for compromised or sensitive skin. The formula also includes fermented green tea, adding antioxidant benefits to keep skin looking fresh and healthy. Unlike some thick creams that sit on the surface, Lala Retro‚Ñ¢ absorbs beautifully, leaving my skin plump, nourished, and perfectly prepped for the day or night ahead. If you're looking for a moisturizer that deeply hydrates while reinforcing your skin barrier, this one is worth every drop!gifted by Drunkelephant

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text: I received this product complimentary from drunk elephant! This stunning cream is just what my dry, skin needed. It has a creamy whipped formula that does absorb nicely into my skin without leaving a stickiness behind and a very light scent that is non-bothersome. It doesn't feel super heavy, but it does leave my skin feeling a little greasy while looking a little shiny, so I love to use it at nighttime but there are occasions I wear it during the day especially if I'm looking for a dewy finish. It deeply nourishes and hydrates while protecting my skin against water loss, which improves my moisture balance. Its very calming and refreshing while improving the firmness of my skin and defending it against everyday stressors. Overall, this is an amazing cream that works very well.

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text: There's a reason this blew up! It's one of the most truly nourishing moisturizers I've tried, perfect for overnight and as a base under makeup. My skin is extremely dry, so I'm super happy to have discovered this, especially through winter. Offered by drunk elephant

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text:
I've been using the Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer with Ceramides for a while now, and it's been a game-changer for my skin. The whipped texture feels so luxurious and rich, but it absorbs really nicely without leaving a greasy residue. My skin feels incredibly hydrated and soft, and the addition of ceramides has worked wonders for strengthening my skin barrier.

I also love that it's fragrance-free and doesn't include silicones or essential oils, so it feels gentle even when my skin is extra sensitive. It's like a comforting hug for my face! That being said, if you're acne-prone, it might be worth patch-testing first, as it's pretty rich. But overall, it's become a staple in my skincare routine for those days when my skin needs some extra love. Definitely recommend! Gifted by Drunk Elephant

review_text: This rich cream feels soothing and intensely moisturizing on my dry skin. It might be heavy for oilier complexions, but once it sinks in, there's no greasiness left behind for me. product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text: Complimentary from drunkelephant. This moisturizer is creamy and thick but not greasy feeling. It absorbs quickly and helps my dry combo skin stay moisturized all day. The pump packaging is super convenient for dispensing the right amount of product.

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text: The texture is incredibly light and airy, despite its rich feel, making it a joy to apply. This moisturizer shines in its ability to plump and soften the skin. It leaves a healthy, dewy glow rather than a shiny finish, which I appreciate. I found it particularly effective in combating dryness and restoring my skin's barrier, especially during harsher winter months. However, the price point is a significant drawback. Lala Retro is a premium product, and the cost per ounce is quite high. This makes it a difficult purchase for many, especially considering that there are other effective moisturizers available at more accessible price points. Gifted by drunkelephant

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text:
I will preface my review by saying I have quite dry skin due to the environment. The winter months are especially dry and I enjoy using heavy, thicker creams. Now this cream feels like it was made specifically for my dry skin, I love it! 

The packaging is designed so that you don't have to dip your fingers into a pot, it's more of a jar that you push down to get the product to dispense. I appreciate this especially in terms of cleanliness. 

The ingredients include a Triple-ceramide blend and 5 African oils. I find this really provides the nourishment my skin needs especially in the dryer months. I appreciate that there is no fragrance as my face tends to break out with added fragrance. 

The design of the jar is innovative and I appreciate it as it helps keep the cream sanitary. The packaging consists of a jar that you push down to get the product to dispense. 

The texture of this cream has a thick, whipped, creamy feel. It truly feel like creamy butter. A little bit goes along way and I imagine this will last me 3 months or so (maybe more as we are heading into summer.) It feels very restorative on my skin and absorbs easily leaving my skin feeling hydrated. While the cream is quite thick and buttery, it does not feel heavy on my skin. 

I'd highly recommend this if you have dry skin and are looking for a powerhouse hydrating cream. I give it four stars for the quality, design, and effectiveness. Gifted by drunkelephant

product_name: Drunk Elephant Lala Retro Whipped Moisturizer
review_text: Gifted by Drunk Elephant for my honest review. One thing I really appreciate about this moisturizer is the packaging ‚Äî no need to scoop the cream with your fingers, you just press the top and it dispenses the perfect amount. It's such a clean and easy design. The cream itself feels light, absorbs nicely, and seems perfect for normal to dry skin. Overall, a good option if you like practical packaging and a soft, whipped texture.

product_name: Clinique Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion+
review_text: I bought this product from a cruise so not Sephora but wanted to leave a good review somewhere for someone to see - I have dry sensitive prone to redness skin and I have tried so many skin moisturizers like Kiehls, aestura, la Roche posay, LANEIGE and none of them succeeded really my expectations (they‚Äôre good though).  I was hesitant to try this product because I thought it was gonna be another moisturizer I would waste and a lot of other Clinique products don‚Äôt agree with my skin but I love this one! I heard it‚Äôs a classic and my mom swears by it for her mature skin. I‚Äôm 29.  It doesn‚Äôt bother my occasional redness, I don‚Äôt get acne, it makes my skin feel really soft, it‚Äôs even fit for me to put on in the morning when I just splash water on my skin, doesn‚Äôt make my skin feel tight or any irritation and I love that it supports the skin barrier. The oils in the product surprisingly don‚Äôt bother my skin but beware - there are oils & petroleum which could clog pores. I believe I finally have found my moisturizer I‚Äôll be using as a staple in my skincare routine. 10/10.

review_text:

It works well for normal to dry skin, providing a healthy glow without feeling too heavy.

Overall, it‚Äôs a solid everyday moisturizer that does what it promises‚Äîkeeping skin hydrated and balanced. If you‚Äôre looking for a simple, effective lotion that won‚Äôt clog pores, this is a great option!

review_text:

Final Verdict: This moisturizer is legit. If you've got sensitive skin, this is your new go-to. 10/10
recommend!

product_name: Clinique Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion+
review_text:
This product is for people with very dry, dry and dry combination skin concerns. This Dermatologist-developed lotion is Clinique‚Äôs #1 face moisturizer. This silky, fast-absorbing moisturizing lotion with pure urea and pure glycerin rapidly strengthen the skin barrier. 

Pure Urea is a humectant that occurs naturally in skin. It helps pull in water and bind moisture to skin to help keep it hydrated and balanced. 

Pure Glycerin is a powerful humectant that supports your skin‚Äôs natural moisture barrier by attracting moisture from the air and retaining water in skin to help keep skin hydrated. 

Pro-lipids help support the skin‚Äôs natural barrier. 

Dermatologist tested. Non-Acnegenic. Allergy tested. 100% fragrance free. 

This daily face moisturizer delivers 8-hour hydration + soothing moisture for skin in need of comfort. It also replenishes skin‚Äôs oil-water balance for healthy skin. It‚Äôs skin strengthening formula helps to strengthen the skin‚Äôs moisture barrier so more moisture stays in. It is suitable to use as soon as one day post a non-ablative laser procedure. 

Use it all over your face/neck twice daily or where needed. For best results use after cleansing and exfoliating. 

I have been using this moisturizer for a week morning and night and it is just ok. Yes, it does moisturize my dry skin but I have used others that feel and look better on my skin. It does pretty much sink into my skin right away and it gives me a nice glowing look. It is also non-greasy. My favourite part of this moisturizer is it is 100% fragrance free! I truly dislike fragrance in my skincare. It is available at most drugstore‚Äôs and other stores with a beauty department. As well as Clinique‚Äôs official website. It is also not overly expensive for the amount you get. 

I have tried and use other moisturizers that moisturize my dry skin better and last longer also I get a better glow. I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

review_text: I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes but I've used different iterations of this moisturizer for years. I remember first trying it as a part of Clinique's suggested skincare routine when I was much younger and now that my skin is more mature and dehydrated, I wasn't sure that this would work the same. This formula claims to repair the skin barrier which really intrigued me. it definitely hydrates without leaving a greasy feeling as it quickly absorbs into the skin. I usually have to put on a thick layer of moisturizer for it to last me throughout the day but I did not need to do that with this one. There were no dry patches that appeared and my skin didn't feel uncomfortable tight with wear time. This formula is also fragrance free so it doesn't irritate my sensitive skin.

product_name: Clinique Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion+
review_text:
I've been using Clinique's Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion+‚Ñ¢ for some time now, and overall, it's a great everyday moisturizer, especially for those with normal to dry skin. It has a lightweight, silky texture that absorbs quickly without leaving a greasy or heavy residue. My skin feels soft, smooth, and nourished after application, and I appreciate that it layers well under makeup without pilling.

One of the standout aspects of this moisturizer is its barrier-repairing properties. With continued use, I‚Äôve noticed my skin feeling more resilient and balanced, which is a huge plus, especially in harsher weather conditions. I also love that it‚Äôs fragrance-free and suitable for sensitive skin‚Äîno irritation or breakouts, which is sometimes a concern with richer creams.

That being said, while it does a good job of maintaining hydration throughout the day, I find that it‚Äôs not quite rich enough for extremely dry skin, especially in the winter months. If my skin is feeling extra parched, I usually have to layer it with a more intensive moisturizer or a hydrating serum to get the level of moisture I need.

Overall, this is a reliable, dermatologist-developed moisturizer that delivers consistent results. It‚Äôs a great staple for daily skincare routines, but if you're looking for deep, long-lasting hydration, you may need something a bit richer. Still, it's a solid choice for keeping the skin balanced and healthy!

Note: I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

product_name: Clinique Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion+
review_text: I have been using this product from past few weeks, it does provide some instant hydration to my skin but it does not keep my skin hydrated for long. It did not break out my skin though. Overall, I would not recommend this for very dry skin.

review_text:

I suggest that you purchase a bottle and see what this Clinique skincare gem can do for you. You will appreciate the thirst -quenching benefits that offer healthy looking skin.

review_text: I got the whole Clinique set - toner, face wash, lotion, everything - in June and am still trying to repair the damage today. The products caused serious cystic acne, milia, whiteheads, blackheads, and excessive oil production. Would not recommend.

product_name: Clinique Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion+
review_text: To all those bad comments i just read through, you obviously have DRY skin that isn't acne prone so i am not really sure why you even bought this product? its not targeted towards dry skin what so ever. It's specifically a GEL formula for acne prone skin because moisturizer can make us feel greasy, we need a moisturizer that is drying but also hydrates without irritating our skin barrier plus we have lots of oil being pushed through our oil glands hence why we are so acne prone. Please do some actual research before you leave a bad review for a product that doesn't even cater to you !!! anyways. I love this moisturizer i use the whole acne three step line and i have oily/combination skin ! definitely try to get all the products together and use them consistently i used everything once a day for awhile until my skin built some sort of tolerance i suggest you do the same if your skin is very prone to drying. especially if you're using this entire line with the cleanser and exfoliating lotion. These products are for real ACNE. not a little white head from here and there so please do not waste your money on a product that isn't made for you there are a million other products that DO cater to you. More specificfly if you have clear skin , why are you buying this? you should not be using this if you aren't acne prone at all. Don't dis encourage others just because you literally bought a product that's made for oily skin. I will 100% repurchase this once i'm finished this is going to be such a good moisturizer for the summer i'm very happy with my purchases:3

product_name: Clinique Dramatically Different Moisturizing Lotion+
review_text: I just want to start off by saying that I have not been able to try this lotion long-term as I really wish I could. It is such a shame because the lotion felt really nice on my face and really promising, but as soon as I looked at the back of ingredients, and I noticed it had ingredients like artificial dyes such as yellow, red, and mineral oil, I had to put it down. I have been on a recent health conscious wellness journey that includes the product that I put on my skin/hair, so I have been opting for products that don't include fragrance or artificial dyes, mineral, oil, pathlates etc., and are more on the clean side. Artificial dyes are very disruptive to our health. I would much rather slather a product that doesnt have an "aesthetic" color or fragrance, but that I know will be super beneficial to my skin and overall health. It is not worth it to me to spend almost $40 on a skincare product that will not be mindful of the negative impact of its ingredients. I hope others can also be more conscious of their products as this will be beneficial long term to your health. That being said, I appreciate other clinique products that are afyuakly on the cleaner side. Thank you.

product_name: Est√©e Lauder Revitalizing Supreme+ Global Anti-Aging Cream
review_text:
I've been using the Est√©e Lauder Revitalizing Supreme+ Youth Power Creme SPF 25 Moisturizer for about 3.5 weeks, and while it's too early to see significant changes (the brand recommends 12 weeks for optimal results), I've already noticed some great benefits. My skin feels incredibly hydrated, looks healthier, and has a lovely glow. I appreciate the SPF 25, which saves me from worrying about applying separate sunscreen.
One thing to note is that the cream can feel slightly heavy and greasy when first applied, but it absorbs nicely into the skin, leaving no residue behind.
Overall, I'm impressed with this moisturizer, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a good, hydrating cream with SPF protection. The combination of hyaluronic acid, moringa extract, and peptides seems to be doing wonders for my skin, and I'm excited to see the long-term results.
Some key benefits of this product include:
Hydration: Provides 72-hour hydration and strengthens the skin's moisture barrier
Anti-aging: Helps reduce fine lines, wrinkles, and loss of elasticity
SPF Protection: Offers broad-spectrum protection against UVA/UVB rays
Keep in mind that everyone's skin type is different, so your experience may vary. I'm looking forward to continuing to use this product and seeing how it works for me in the long run. 
I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

review_text:
I've been using the Est√©e Lauder Revitalizing Supreme+ Youth Power Cr√®me for a few weeks now, and I'm genuinely impressed. product_name: Lanc√¥me R√©nergie H.P.N. 300-Peptide Cream
review_text:
I've been using the Est√©e Lauder Revitalizing Supreme+ Youth Power Creme SPF 25 Moisturizer for about 3.5 weeks, and while it's too early to see significant changes (the brand recommends 12 weeks for optimal results), I've already noticed some great benefits. My skin feels incredibly hydrated, looks healthier, and has a lovely glow. I appreciate the SPF 25, which saves me from worrying about applying separate sunscreen.
One thing to note is that the cream can feel slightly heavy and greasy when first applied, but it absorbs nicely into the skin, leaving no residue behind.
Overall, I'm impressed with this moisturizer, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a good, hydrating cream with SPF protection. The combination of hyaluronic acid, moringa extract, and peptides seems to be doing wonders for my skin, and I'm excited to see the long-term results.
Some key benefits of this product include:
Hydration: Provides 72-hour hydration and strengthens the skin's moisture barrier
Anti-aging: Helps reduce fine lines, wrinkles, and loss of elasticity
SPF Protection: Offers broad-spectrum protection against UVA/UVB rays
Keep in mind that everyone's skin type is different, so your experience may vary. I'm looking forward to continuing to use this product and seeing how it works for me in the long run. 
I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

review_text:
I absolutely love Estee Lauder.  I normally wear their Resilience Multi-Effect Moisturizer Tri-Peptide Face and Neck Creme SPF 15, however I'm finding it a little heavy for Spring/Summer.  This REVITALIZING SUPREME+ SPF25 was a welcoming change as I've now tested it during the Summer when my skin isn't as dry and has a superior amount of added moisture to it (it's not heavy feeling but drenches and plumps your skin).  While it has a decent SPF amount, I still wear it under an SPF50 first (and let it soak in well first).  This also pairs nicely with their Perfectionist Pro Serum in which this does not pill after applied.  Again glad I tried it out as it's now my Spring/Summer go to for my moisturizer.  Sunscreen layers nicely on top and doesn't pill either.  I do not recommend this at night as it has SPF in it.  I still stick with my Resilience Multi-Effect Night cream on top of my Advanced Night Repair serum.

Overall, the Lanc√¥me R√©nergie H.P.N. 300 Peptide Cream has become a staple in my skincare routine. review_text: I was delighted to get the opportunity to review & try this product! I have been using this for several weeks, noticing a decrease in fine lines, smoothing my skin overall & those darned dark spots from sunworshiping are fading & looking lighter.  I love the idea of  a product that will reduce lower face sagging bc that seems to be a trouble spot & where things start (no pun intended) start going south after 50.  I don't need much to cover my face & neck area which means that it will last quite a while.  I look forward to seeing more results with longer use.  Will I purchase it?  Yes I will & I will tell all of my friends bc this stuff is fabulous!!!

review_text: I would never have believed this change in product could make such a difference in my skin. This cream has given my face a softness that feels delicious and a glow that I haven't  had before. This is my new favorite product.

product_name: Lanc√¥me R√©nergie H.P.N. 300-Peptide Cream
review_text: When I used this product the first few days, I was instantly floored! I felt like my skin was brighter and dewy, the added benefits of peptides and SPF is also a huge plus. Initially I really loved the idea of this product because of my curiosity of starting to use peptides in my skincare routine. I was excited to be sent this product and to also finally give the Lancome skincare line a try. This cream is a little thicker than I am used to for a day cream in the Spring/Summer but the texture was smooth, a little greasy, and the scent is pleasant. After about a couple of weeks, I noticed my pores were a bit clogged with whiteheads and I had a couple of breakouts. Now I will say, the warm weather is probably not suited for this type of day cream on my combination skin so I can see this cream being way better for me in the cooler, dryer Fall/Winter seasons and will wait to give it a full re-try again then. I still think this is a great day cream to try if you are looking for something with SPF and has the added anti-aging benefits.

review_text:

I've tried many and this R√©nergie H.P.N. 300-Peptide Anti-Aging Cream SPF 25 from Lanc√¥me is definitely one of the best. It's very hydrating without feeling too heavy. My face tends to sweat ALOT and it doesn't feel like it just sits on the surface of my skin and roll off throughout the day. It makes my skin feel plump & smooth when I use it consistently and it leaves my skin looking radiant & healthy! As usual there's just something special to me about Lanc√¥me products, I've been using them since I was very young‚Ä¶I would sneak through my moms products growing up (which were mainly all Lanc√¥me) and use everything I could find lol!! (sorry mom LOL)

product_name: Lanc√¥me R√©nergie H.P.N. 300-Peptide Cream
review_text:
I received this product for free in exchange for my honest opinion. Here we go. I googled this product and it's pricey. So not worth it.
First...the smell: it's overwhelming and obnoxious. It smells like something from Avon circa 1954 that has gone bad in the back of great aunt Marge's vanity and was found last year after she died. This is a PRESTIGE brand; why does it smell like something the coroner would use too cover decomp? 
Second: I have no idea if it is the perfume or the chemicals, but my eyes BURNED...they watered like someone had thrown chemicals directly into my eyes. I am not a particularly sensitive person. Either to scents or ingredients. But this was awful.
I tried applying to the back of my hand and gently spreading to let the product "dry down" slightly. Nope. It was just as bad. Just having it on the back of my hands made my eyes water. 
I can't imagine how bad it would be if you actually had allergies to these products.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text:
I've been using the Est√©e Lauder Revitalizing Supreme+ Youth Power Creme SPF 25 Moisturizer for about 3.5 weeks, and while it's too early to see significant changes (the brand recommends 12 weeks for optimal results), I've already noticed some great benefits. My skin feels incredibly hydrated, looks healthier, and has a lovely glow. I appreciate the SPF 25, which saves me from worrying about applying separate sunscreen.
One thing to note is that the cream can feel slightly heavy and greasy when first applied, but it absorbs nicely into the skin, leaving no residue behind.
Overall, I'm impressed with this moisturizer, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a good, hydrating cream with SPF protection. The combination of hyaluronic acid, moringa extract, and peptides seems to be doing wonders for my skin, and I'm excited to see the long-term results.
Some key benefits of this product include:
Hydration: Provides 72-hour hydration and strengthens the skin's moisture barrier
Anti-aging: Helps reduce fine lines, wrinkles, and loss of elasticity
SPF Protection: Offers broad-spectrum protection against UVA/UVB rays
Keep in mind that everyone's skin type is different, so your experience may vary. I'm looking forward to continuing to use this product and seeing how it works for me in the long run. 
I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

review_text:

While it has a decent SPF amount, I still wear it under an SPF50 first (and let it soak in well first).  This also pairs nicely with their Perfectionist Pro Serum in which this does not pill after applied.  Again glad I tried it out as it's now my Spring/Summer go to for my moisturizer.  Sunscreen layers nicely on top and doesn't pill either.  I do not recommend this at night as it has SPF in it.  I still stick with my Resilience Multi-Effect Night cream on top of my Advanced Night Repair serum.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text:
I tried this when it was at a great Christmas gift set price. The jars lasted me until September. I've started to look around for something new because I feel like I could find something a little more moisturizing. I'm 55 and I feel like I need something a little heavier.

But now that I'm trying other moisturizers, I have a new appreciation for this one! It absorbs very fast, there's no added perfume, it's light and refreshing, you dont have to tug at skin rubbing it in like a thicker cream,  there's no shiny face afterward. I have sensitive skin on my chest and it's never caused redness or any reaction at all.  I even use it as an eye cream without any problem. 

I didn't realize how hard that is to find! I've tried and returned 2 moisturizers already and I hate to do that. If I can't find a replacement soon, I'm seriously considering just sticking with this!

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text:
I have extremely sensitive skin and suffer from papulopustular rosacea, which lately has been confined mostly to my nose. I have used Clinique Gel Moisturizer for over 16 years, but it started making my rosacea worse recently and burning my skin.

I received a .95oz sample of this Kiehl's moisturizer from Ulta and was very happy with the ingredients list. I am even more happy with the results!! This moisturizer has transformed my skin. It's happy, clear and nothing in this irritates my skin. My skin LOVES this stuff. This is my new go-to. Even in the humid midwest summer heat, it doesn't clog pores and really does pull moisture into your skin. I'll be interested to see how it works in the winter but I am hoping for my best winter skin with this new product.

10/10 would change nothing except the price, but I'm saving money just by having healthy skin.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: don't be fooled. I thought this would be a nice simple, fragrance-free moisturizer for my acne prone combination skin. after 2 weeks of use I experienced whiteheads, oiliness, dryness/itchiness/irritation, texture EVERYWHERE and deep, cystic pimples that hurt to the touch. it hasn't been as bad since, but it took me 6 months and lots of adapelene to clear the acne and scars. I looked it up & my suspicions were confirmed- this ranks highly for comedogenic ingredients!! be careful and pls spare yourself if you have acne prone skin. im sure its a great moisturizer for other skin types.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I picked this as my birthday gift and was glad I did.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I have been having problems with dry skin and this makes my skin so moisturized and glowy i highly recommend this product

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: This moisturizer broke my face out after 2 uses and took over 1 week to fully resolve. It basically caused tiny skin colored bumps all over my face. If you have senstive skin I wouldnt recommened!

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: Very light weight and feels so good on my skin. I have extremely dry skin and psoriasis and it has helped tremendously with my dry patches.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I hope this is never changed or discontinued. I've been struggling with skin issues that came out of nowhere. Acne, dryness, irritation, texture. I read online a lot of people with redness and rosacea said this worked for them, so I tried it, not with high hopes. I've tried nearly EVERYTHING. I can't even list all the moisturizers I've tried. They all irritate my skin and make me breakout or turn red or burn and sting. This stuff doesn't at all! Not only that, it's THE MOST MOISTURIZING PRODUCT I HAVE EVER USED, hands down! On top of that, after a couple weeks, it's completely changed my skin. My skin looks literally like glass! It's SO SMOOTH, the texture is GONE, my pores are small and smooth, I have a glow that I've never had in my life and I'm 35! my skin is SO SOFT and supple. I will NEVER LET THIS STUFF GO. If they see this, please DONT CHANGE IT! I've tried them all from every brand and this is MILES BEYOND the rest. If you're considering trying it, try it! They do offer a small trial size (at least as of now). Not everything works for everyone, but try it!

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: It is really good, i got pne for my ulta b-day present and i do not regret picking it at all and i have nevere used something better that this. I will definitely be buying this next time!

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: Really lightweight, but still very moisturizing somewhat of a gel cream. I have really dry skin and it's basically brought my skin back to life. I love it and I'll definitely be purchasing it.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: i got this product 3-4 weeks ago and i havent been putting much makeup on and i noticed blemishes under  my eyes so i stoped using the cream and switched to cetaphil and the blemishes went away.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I have used the product for several years. It is lightweight and easily absorbed.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I wanted to love this because it makes your skin so soft and it feels weightless - but everytime I've used this product I seem to breakout :(

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: For the last 3 years I've been using a moisturizer that costs $60 for 1.7oz. I tried this because I had a coupon for a free mini. I was hooked after the first use! No pilling, no balling up. It absorbs nicely and my skin feels phenomenal!! I wish I would've tried this moisturizer sooner! My skin looks so plump and hydrated. The texture of this cream is very lightweight, but still feels very moisturizing. I have balanced to dry skin and I am in my 40s. I could see someone with oily skin not liking this especially if their skin is very oily. I love the squalane in this moisturizer. This is my new go to moisturizer, not only is it less expensive than the one I've been using, but it's also much better!!

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I was skeptical about the price but I have heard so much about this product and I've been using it for about 2 weeks now and it is great! Consistency is good and it's soft on my skin. I would recommend it to anyone.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: BEST  FACIAL  CREAM  I  HAVE  EVER  USED

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I read other comments about it stinging when they put it on and should have listened. That being said, I do have sensitive skin, so if you don't I would still recommend this moisturizer.  It absorbs well and doesn't leave your face feeling greasy.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: Love this moisturizer. Layers great under sunscreen and makeup. Non greasy, doesn't pill, no fragrance. Will continue to buy over and over!

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: Ive been buying this product consistently for 8 years.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I cannot love this moisturizer more. I have eczema and very dry skin, and this keeps feeling moisturized all day. This moisturizer is definitely more expensive than other budget friendly options, but well worth it for me. I had the .95 oz jar to try it first, so I ordered the 8.5 oz jar because it is the cheapest option per oz. If I didn't order this from Ulta I would have assumed I was scammed. The jar quality of the 8.5 compared to the .95 jar was very poor. The label was a sticker as opposed to printed directly on the jar, and it was even on the jar crooked! A bit of a bummer that it doesnt feel as luxe as the smaller jar.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: After reading the reviews, I was curious and wanted to try this moisturizer for my dry skin if you have really dry skin, I do not recommend this at all I had to reapply this moisturizer more than once, just for it to moisturize my face it also for some reason peels out of my feet, and when I use make up with it, it starts peeling even worse than it looks hideous. I do not recommend this at all.

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: After years of searching for a moisturizer for my combo skin I have finally found my Goldilocks moisturizer

product_name: Kiehl‚Äôs Ultra Facial Moisturizing Cream with Squalane
review_text: I have really sensitive skin and tried this moisturizer based on its high reviews, but it left my skin feeling irritated and dry after using. I would recommend trying another moisturizer if your skin is very sensitive like mine.
